studyID: The stable, unique identifier for a study that never changes, even if other study metadata changes (like the study name, short name, owner, or project). Example: STUDY_SCA
optional persistent row identifier: Use studyID as the anchor, plus a persistent row identifier to identify a specific file/version, etc.
optional persistent row identifier - va: Enter a unique identifier for the selection made.
optional appliesTo: Indicates the level of entity to which a metadata value applies (e.g., individual participant or population summary).
optional aggregationLevel: Specifies whether a metadata value represents individual-level data or an aggregate summary
optional populationScope: Identifies the population described by the metadata (e.g., study-wide, cohort, or study arm).
externallyRequestable: Availability indicator to request the data.
irbApprovalNumber: The identifier assigned by the IRB for an approved or reviewed study, if applicable.
irbStatus: The regulatory determination of IRB oversight for the study.
irbInstitution: The institution or ethics committee responsible for IRB review or determination.
irbExemptionType: The regulatory exemption category under which the study was determined to be exempt from IRB review.
irbApprovalDescription: Free-text description providing additional context about IRB approval, exemption, or oversight.
irbScope: Scope of IRB in relation to the study.
accessProcedure: Brief description of the steps required to request and obtain access to the dataset.
accessRequestURL: URL to the access request page/portal or repository instructions for obtaining access.
dataLocation: Where the dataset is hosted or distributed (e.g., Synapse project, NIMH/NDAR collection, dbGaP).
accessContact: Point of contact (team, email alias, or role) for access questions.
accessReviewBody: The entity that reviews/approves access requests (e.g., DAC, IRB, sponsor).
accessRequirements: Checklist of materials required for access (e.g., DUA, IRB letter, training).
